page.title: 02Ecology - Mattingley Area.
page.content: Three contrasting natural{habitats can be found within the block.{Hazeley {Heath}- a{Site of Scientific Interest is the home for Adders, Badgers, Foxes &{Deer.}Roe Deer are most common with herds of up to 50. There are also Fallow, Red, Muntjac & Sika deer plus 'White Harts'.{Nightingales}can be heard & the{flora}includes wild Raspberries,, Heath Spotted Orchids, Lesser Skullcap, Long-leaved Sundew, Common Cotton-grass & Bee Orchids. The{Copses}contain Bluebells, Wood Anemones & Primroses whilst the {Whitewater Valley}plays host to Yellow Water-Lilies, Wild Irises, Milk-maids, Meadow Sweet etc. Many{hedgerows}have been retained & a number of trees in the area have{preservation orders}on them - an indication of the growing awareness of the need for {conservation.
